title: The best sports streaming options for Patriots, Red Sox, Bruins, and Celtics fans
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Streaming Watching every Patriots, Celtics, Bruins, and Red Sox game on TV can be tough without shelling out a lot of money for cable.
Here's some of the best sports streaming options for Boston sports fans — as well as some helpful tips for watching your favorite teams outside of New England.
Boston Bruins forward David Pastrnak, Boston Celtics forward Jaylen Brown, and New England Patriots quarterback Drake Maye.

title: We asked Boston Common visitors what they’re listening to — here’s what they said
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Community From Taylor Swift to Brahms, we asked park-goers about the soundtrack of their autumn days.
Ducks in the Boston Common, surrounded by changing fall leaves.
Kelly Chan/Boston.

title: BU College Republicans president says he called ICE ‘for months’ before Allston Car Wash raid
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News “As someone who lives in the neighborhood, I’ve seen how American jobs are being given away to those with no right to be here,” Zac Segal wrote.
Nine employees were detained Nov.
4 while on the job at Allston Car Wash.

title: In Canada, Wu helps chop down Boston’s Christmas tree
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News Mayor Michelle Wu spent three days in Nova Scotia, saying she wanted to affirm Boston's relationship with Canada amid antagonism from the Trump administration.
Boston Mayor Michelle Wu helps cut down a white spruce tree that was selected as Nova Scotia's 2025 Tree for Boston.
Darren Calabrese /The Canadian Press via AP Boston Mayor Michelle Wu returned to the city Wednesday after spending three days in Nova Scotia.

title: John Cena becomes WWE Grand Slam Champion in final Boston home match
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Entertainment The West Newbury native stopped at TD Garden for his farewell tour, earning his last major WWE title and celebrating “John Cena Day.
” John Cena answers audience questions in a live Q&A at Fan Expo Boston.
Nikki Marie Cardiello/Fan Expo Boston gave WWE superstar John Cena a final legendary send off on Nov.

title: Patriots to debut new ‘Rivalries’ jerseys Thursday night
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: New England Patriots "Rugged, weathered, and worn in, like the coastline after a gale.

" Patriots will debut their "Rivalry" jerseys Thursday night against the Jets (New England Patriots) New England Patriots A nor’easter will be coming to Foxborough Thursday night, as the Patriots take on the Jets.
Looking to improve to 9-2, New England will debut their new “Rivalries” jerseys for this divisional matchup.

title: Son of MBTA Transit Police chief convicted of manslaughter
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Brian Green was found guilty of killing his estranged wife’s boyfriend as the couple slept in an Everett apartment.
Brian Green during his arraignment in 2022.

Nancy Lane / Boston Herald, Pool By Abby Patkin updated on November 13, 2025 | 1:12 PM 2 minutes to read A Saugus man whose father is chief of the MBTA Transit Police was convicted of manslaughter Wednesday for killing his estranged wife’s boyfriend as the couple slept in an Everett apartment.

title: Boston guests left without rooms as Sonder shutters rentals nationwide
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Business The short-term rental company that operated three properties in Boston abruptly shut down, leaving customers stranded.
The San Francisco-based short-term rental and boutique hotel company Sonder abruptly shut down operations Sunday as it prepares to file for bankruptcy, leaving guests and employees scrambling.
The Airbnb rival operated three properties in Boston — two in the Back Bay and one in Fenway.

title: Somerville pupusa crawl: How a chef is putting El Salvador’s national dish on the map
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Food Dos Manos chef Edwin Orellana wants more people to know about the delicious — and affordable — pupusa.
Luckily, they’re easy to find in Somerville.
Pupusas at the former Ball Square restaurant, Cristian Latin.

title: A 60-year-old NH ski area is bought by close friends who grew up skiing there
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Skiing The mountain opens for the season Dec.
Ragged Mountain in Danbury, N.
